definition: to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: The horse twisted and bucked and finally dismounted its rider.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马扭动并猛然弓背跃起把骑手摔下马。

sentences.english: There shall always be the impression of a harmonious cooperation between horse and rider.
sentences.chinese: 骑手和马之间与永远要表现得合谐合作的印象。

sentences.english: The effectiveness of the rider's aids determines the precise fulfilment of the required movements of the tests.
sentences.chinese: 骑手扶助的效率，决定执行测验中的动作的精准度。

sentences.english: The rider pulled his horsed up short.
sentences.chinese: 骑手突然一下把马勒住。

sentences.english: Fine accolades from a horseman of Bob Battaglia's distinction.
sentences.chinese: 从骑手鲍勃巴塔利亚的区别精细的赞誉。

sentences.english: Machine binding: Binding by machine rather than manually by hand.
sentences.chinese: 根据骑手一只马反应出身体信号的动机。

sentences.english: The wild horse bucked its second rider off.
sentences.chinese: 野马猛然弓背跃起，把第二个骑手摔下了。

sentences.english: He can ride a horse like a horseman.
sentences.chinese: 他马骑得和骑手一样好。

sentences.english: The self-coached cyclist must learn to think objectively and unemotionally.
sentences.chinese: 自我辅导的骑手必须学习客观及不动情感的思考模式。

sentences.english: His figure was enveloped in a riding cloak, fur collared and steel clasped;
sentences.chinese: 他身上裹着骑手披风，戴着皮毛领，系着钢扣子。

sentences.english: So the horses are well catered for, but what about the riders?
sentences.chinese: 马得到了良好的保障，骑手呢？

sentences.english: The mysterious rider dissolved into the mists.
sentences.chinese: 那个神秘的骑手在雾中消失了。

sentences.english: You had four horsemen representing four different things.
sentences.chinese: 前面的四名骑手代表了四样东西。
该骑手肯定是得到超速罚单。

sentences.english: The contact should be independent from the athlete's seat.
sentences.chinese: 手与口衔的接触应该要独立于骑手的骑坐之外。

sentences.english: He is a gentle horse that never cast his rider.
sentences.chinese: 驯顺的马毫不会把骑手甩倒。

definition: to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses
person in charge of pack animals/chariot driver
to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
to take a customer's order/(of a taxi driver) to accept a booking/(of a delivery rider) to accept a delivery job
to drive a vehicle for its owner (often as a paid service for sb who has consumed alcohol) (abbr. for 代理駕駛|代理驾驶[dai4 li3 jia4 shi3])/substitute driver (abbr. for 代駕司機|代驾司机[dai4 jia4 si1 ji1])
to go/take out (relates to food bought at a restaurant)
